title: O Blessed Savior
author: Joseph Stennett (1663-1713)
presentation: v1 v2 v3 v4 v5 v6 v7

v1: O blessed Savior, is Thy love
So great, so full, so free?
Behold, I give my love, my heart,
My life, my all to Thee.
v2: I love Thee for the glorious worth
I love Thee for that shameful cross,
v3: No man of greater love can boast
Than for his friend to die;
Thou for Thine enemies wast slain!
What love with Thine can vie?
v4: Though in the very form of God,
Thou wouldst partake of human flesh,
v5: Thou wouldst like wretched man be made
That we as like Thee might become
v6: Like Thee in faith, in meekness, love,
v7: O Lord, I'll treasure in my soul
And Thy dear name shall still to me
